modules.description: This module defines core data types for representing structured wikitext documents, including block-level elements like lists, tables, and document structure. It provides types to distinguish ordered vs. unordered lists, table cells vs. headers, and definition list terms vs. descriptions. These types are used to model wikitext syntax trees for parsing, transformation, and rendering tasks.

This module supports AST transformations for wikitext documents through recursive mapping, enabling custom processing of blocks, inline elements, and tables. It operates on structured wikitext types like blocks, inlines, and table blocks, providing specific functions for tasks such as link rendering, TOC generation, and text normalization. Concrete use cases include converting wikitext to HTML, modifying document structure, and injecting auto-generated content like tables of contents.

This module parses wikitext from strings, files, or channels into a structured document type and renders it to HTML through callbacks, channels, or files. It defines a document tree with block and inline elements, supporting transformations and custom processing via recursive mapping. You can use it to convert wikitext to HTML, generate tables of contents, normalize text, or modify document structure during rendering. The core types in `Type` model elements like lists, tables, and definitions, while `Mapper` enables deep transformations over those structures.
